column4: hi, anyone have some spare time to help me with installing ubuntu? something really weird is happening to my installation ='(

well i'm trying to install ubuntu on my laptop so i downloaded the Desktop version, x86, plopp it in, boot it, i get to the first menu where it says "Start or install ubuntu" ect, i push F3 or F4 whatever to choose keymap then hit enter
it starts loading a bunch of stuff thinking thinking thinking and then it stops at the terminal?
most likely... that was my problem... it's possible it's a problem with your hardware, but ubuntu is _really_ good at autodetect
also, if you don't have a floppy drive, it'll take a few minutes longer

another display manager?
2007-04-30T13:32:00.000Z	Possum	MIST_	what does another display manager" mean? Did you have graphics at all?
blinking is normal for livecds... tries to detect proper res
That was my problem -- a scratch on the CD... check https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HowToMD5SUM but I doubt it's your problem :(
great, once you get ubuntu installed you gotta try beryl :)
CheshireViking, if you're still having problems tomorrow, I'll be in here
